revisions.rev:
{{Feminism sidebar |expanded=Lists}}
This is a list of important participants in the development of [[feminism]].
<!-- Where an associated biographical page is not available as an internal link, reliable sources should be added, to establish notability. -->
== Feminists == <!-- Please insert alphabetically by surname. --> {{Main|Feminism}} * [[Lesley Abdela]], British feminist fl. 2010 * [[Abigail Adams]] (1744â1818), [[First Lady of the United States]] * [[Jane Addams]] (1860â1935) * [[Sophie Adlersparre]] (1823â1895) * [[Alfhild Agrell]] (1849â1923) * [[Heinrich Cornelius Agrippa]] (1486â1535), author of ''Declamation on the Nobility and Preeminence of the Female Sex'' * [[Catharina Ahlgren]] (1734â1783), Swedish journalist and feminist * [[Linda MartÃ­n Alcoff]] * [[Alan Alda]], U.S. actor (''[[M*A*S*H*]]'' and ''[[The West Wing]]'') who campaigned for Equal Rights Amendment in the 1970s and early 1980s * [[Soteria Aliberty]], Greek educator and writer * [[Elisabeth Altmann-Gottheiner]] (1874â1930), German university lecturer * [[Ellen AnckarsvÃ¤rd]] (1833â1898), Swedish feminist * [[Adelaide Anderson]] (1863â1936), British * [[Elizabeth Garrett Anderson]] (1836â1917), British physician and suffragist * [[Louisa Garrett Anderson]] (1873â1943), British physician and [[suffragette]] * [[Jane Anger]], author of ''Her Protection for Women'', published 1589 in London * [[Susan B.
